content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's the function `extract_julia_code` in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    lines = split(md, "\n")
    state = "normal"
    code_blocks = String[]
    for i in 1:length(lines)
        if lines[i] == "```" && state == "normal"
            state = "code_block"
            push!(code_blocks, "")
        elseif (lines[i-1][1:3] == "# @" || lines[i-1][1:2] == "<@") && state == "code_block"
            state = "normal"
            push!(code_blocks, lines[i-1])
        elseif lines[i] == "```" && state == "code_block"
            state = "normal"
            push!(code_blocks, lines[i])
        elseif state == "code_block"
            push!(code_blocks, lines[i])
        end
    end
    
    code_block_texts = [strip(x)[3:end-2] for x in code_blocks if x â‰  nothing && x != ""]
    return join(code_block_texts, "\n")
end
```

This function takes a markdown document as input and extracts all the Julia code blocks. It removes the code fences (the ```) and joins the extracted code blocks together with a newline (\n). The function returns a string containing all the joined code blocks.
